Since May 2020, Iâ€™m an Applied Scientist at Amazon A9 working on neural information retrieval.

I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University, where I was advised by Prof. Christos Faloutsos and supported partially by the Snap Graduate Fellowship. My thesis work focused on anomaly detection and semi-supervised learning in graphs.

I received my B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Madras in 2015.
